snippet: Julia Trigg Crawford and her family have had multiple visits from TransCanada representatives regarding land rights to their farm in Sumner, Tex.
abstract: Julia Trigg Crawford, farmer in Sumner, Tex, who had initially refused TransCanada Corp the rights to her land to let the planned Keystone XL pipeline cross through, discovers that her property has been condemned and a lease awarded to the company without her consent; she is appealing the condemnation, which is legal under a state law that allows certain private companies to use right of eminent domain to force landowners to let pipelines through.
lead_paragraph: Julia Trigg Crawford and her family have had multiple visits from TransCanada representatives regarding land rights to their farm in Sumner, Tex.

headline.seo: Old Texas Tale Retold: Farmer vs. TransCanada
headline.main: An Old Texas Tale Retold: the Farmer vs. the Oil Company
headline.print_headline: An Old Texas Tale Retold: the Farmer vs. the Oil Company
